The terms of the new sequence add to $836$. Find the sum of the first, last, and middle terms of the original sequence.

The $k$th term of the new sequence is $a_k + (2k-1)$.
The sum of the terms of the new sequence is $S_2 = 836$.

$S_2 = S_1 + n(n+1) - n$

$836 = 715 + n^2$
$n^2 = 121$
$n = 11$
The sum of the original sequence is $715 = \frac{11}{2}(a_1 + a_{11})$.
$a_1 + a_{11} = \frac{2(715)}{11} = \frac{1430}{11} = 130$
The middle term is $a_6 = \frac{a_1 + a_{11}}{2} = \frac{130}{2} = 65$
The first term of the sequence is $a_1$.
The last term is $a_{11}$.
The middle term is $a_6$.
